page.title: 19FARMING
page.content:
By 1940 there were over 1,000 acres of glass. The occupation years (1940-45) saw a great decline in agriculture, from which it has never recovered. Today the competition from abroad has been a serious blow to the tomato grower and many glasshouses are being abandoned. Glasshouses are going cheap and these are now being used by carnation and kiwi fruit growers.
KIWI FRUIT
Today, Kiwi fruit is one of the most rapidly expanding crops in Guernsey. But why is it grown over here ? Mr. N. Brouaed of 'N.Brouard Ltd.' had some of the answers. Today Tomato growing is in decline because of the good economic prospects
